citeinfo.origin: Digital Social Science Center (DSSC), Columbia University Libraries
citeinfo.title: Geological map of the state of Pennsylvania : constructed from original surveys made between 1836 and 1857 (Scanned Map)
citeinfo.origin: W. & A.K. Johnston Limited. ; Geological Survey of Pennsylvania.

descript.abstract: This is a scanned version of the paper map entitled: Geological map of the state of Pennsylvania : constructed from original surveys made between 1836 and 1857. The map was scanned at 300 dots per inch and is in the TIFF format. This map comes in two sheets, the second Sheet is a supplement titled, Geolocial Sections Across Pennsylvania, to illustrate the Geological Map of the State.
descript.purpose: Scanned maps may be used for a variety of purposes. This image may be used in a GIS.
descript.supplinf:
1 map : col., mounted on linen ; 88 x 176 cm., on sheet 140 x 182 cm., folded to 29 x 22 cm.
Scale [ca. 1:330,000]; (W 8032'--W 7441'/N 4217'--N 3943').
Relief shown by hachures./ "To accompany the final report on the Geological Survey of the State 1858."/ Originally published in 4 sheets./ "Entered according to act of Congress, in the year 1858, by Henry D. Rogers ... Eastern District of Pennsylvania."/ Washington D.C. prime meridian./ Includes numerous black-and-white cross-sections.
under the superintendence of Henry D. Rogers, state geologist ; engraved by W. & A.K. Johnston, Edinburgh.

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

dataqual.logic: The raster image is a faithfully reproduced digital image of the original source map. Some differences may be detected between the source graphic used and the raster image due to the RGB values assigned that particular color. The intent is to recreate those colors as near as possible.
dataqual.complete: Data completeness for digitized paper map files reflect the content of the source graphic.

procstep.procdesc: Original map was scanned at 300 dpi and saved in .tiff format with Colortrac5480 Scanner
